content: @Minerva Panda let us continue over here ! A simple piece of advice is that with Windows is that it is going to be tough .
I would suggest you start understanding the installation procedure.

@Minerva Panda Just edit this ['sudo', './scripts/lib/setup-apt-repo'] to ``` ['sudo','scripts/lib/setup-apt-repo']````
Also, are you having proper internet ? are you working beind a proxy ?

@Christie Koehler @Tim Abbott I created this stream-topic altogether for future purposes. Consider it to be in continuation to https://zulip.tabbott.net/#narrow/near/30438/stream/installation.20help/topic/ubuntu
Cool, sounds reasonable.

I am facing this error http://hastebin.com/suvugoyato.rb in provisioning the vagrant box in windows . I am doing python tools/provision.pyfrom /srv/zulip/. It would be really helpful if someone helps me with this. I am totally unaware of what RABBITMQ is !
RabbitMQ is a queuing system. Here is some more info: http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/queuing.html?highlight=rabbitmq

This part of the traceback seems relevant:

  File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/ca82ee7860fca0989e3dd68b65a063d489ddaa6b/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/conf/__init__.py", line 113, in __init__
    raise ImproperlyConfigured("The SECRET_KEY setting must not be empty.")
django.core.exceptions.ImproperlyConfigured: The SECRET_KEY setting must not be empty.
+ RABBITMQ_USERNAME=
<<

My /etc/zulip/zulip-secrets.confshows that rabbitmq_password=None . Do i need to set this manually ? The zprojects/settings.py seems to get the password from /etc/zulip/zulip-secrets.conf and show error that the SECRET_KEY must not be empty !
I would start by figuring out why Django thinks the SECRET_KEY setting is empty. Do you have a file called zproject/dev-secrets.conf?
No. I have dev_settings.py and dev_urls.py but no dev-secrets.conf file in zproject directory .

When you run provision, there should be a step that calls scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py, and that should have generated the conf file, if I'm reading the code correctly. I can see that file in my local configuration, so I am confused why you don't have it.

When I did python scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py manually it generated
(zulip-venv)vagrant@vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64:/srv/zulip$ python scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py development = False Generated Camo config file /etc/default/camo Generated /etc/zulip/zulip-secrets.conf with auto-generated secrets!
Here the development varaible is what is generated in the scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py line 106. Thus, my provisioning generated /etc/zulip/zulip-secrets.conf!
It appears that something about the way you are running provisioning is having it use a production install, not a dev install.
There is no specific way to provision for dev-env for windows . I am following this document http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html

We don't really support windows, as you know, so if you are going to go down this road, you might find that there are certain areas of the install where it's going to be difficult to find help. The key problem here appears to be that somewhere in your installation process, you accidentally started using production settings instead of dev settings.
@Diptanshu Jamgade The way to provision for Windows/Vagrant is the same for OS X and Linux. Run vagrant up on the Cygwin terminal.
The first time you run vagrant up the provision script is automatically run.
To have vagrant re-run the provision, run vagrant provision in Cygwin.
But then this error http://hastebin.com/suvugoyato.rb is troubling me ! Could you please help me!
Also, make sure you are running Cygwin as an administrator.
@Diptanshu Jamgade you get that error as part of running vagrant up or vagrant provision?
vagrant provision ! moreover I am provisioning by after ssh-ing into the vagrant box !
@Diptanshu Jamgade So you ran vagrant ssh to ssh into the machine and then ran python tools/provision.py from the /srv/zulip directory?
Part of the problem here is that somewhere in the process prod settings are getting used instead of dev.
@Christie Koehler Exactly !
@Diptanshu Jamgade How did you get the Zulip code?
Sorry for these questions you may have already been asked. I just want to have a clear understanding of where you are in the process. ;)
I will also get my windows machine and try to provision since I haven't tested that in a while.

@Christie Koehler No problem. I followed the exact steps as mentioned here http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html#requirements. Then I forked zulip repo and clonned it !
Okay. And you're running Cygwin as an administrator?
Basically consider the situation as I am provisioning the vagrant box and then I get that error !
Yes, but I want to make sure to eliminate the simplest sources of error.
Such as running Cygwin not as an administrator.

The first thing to figure out is why some of the steps you have followed so far have led to prod setup instead of dev setup. It might be worthwhile to take a break, read some code, and start fresh with a very methodical approach.
@Christie Koehler I ran it as an administrator else SImlink error was troubling me !
@Diptanshu Jamgade Okay, good.
After that I got stuck !
@Diptanshu Jamgade do you have a log file in the VM, /var/log/zulip_provision.log?
I think the django error you are getting is possibly related to an error that happened earlier.
You should not have to run all the steps of provision.py manually. That is a complicated script and easy to introduce error if you try to run each step on its own.
Yes @Christie Koehler I do have that log file !
@Diptanshu Jamgade Are you able to share it with us?
@Christie Koehler the entire file or just the tail/last occurring error with you ?
@Diptanshu Jamgade entire file if you can
@Christie Koehler I will do that in just 2 minutes. Kindly consider. Apart from this I wanted to ask if provisioning in windows ever gave you this error ?
@Diptanshu Jamgade No, I haven't seen that error with provisionining before.

https://zulip.tabbott.net/#narrow/near/32025/stream/Outreachy.202016-2017/topic/Vagrant
Your reference here points me the fact that am behind a proxy ! though the net speed is fine as well as no frequent drops
zulip_provision.log
there it is /var/log/zulip_provision.log

@Diptanshu Jamgade It looks like provisioning stopped several times on scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py, eventually was able to run it successfully, but then got stuck on scripts/setup/configure-rabbitmq
does that sound correct?
Yes totally ! I would like to mention one thing Kindle refer to particular files that I mention
@Steve Howell Please if you could ...... I had an imp query (in context of our previous discussion regarding shifting from dev env config )
@Diptanshu Jamgade I don't quite understand your last comment.
@Steve Howell and @Christie Koehler if I am not wrong line 181 of tools/provision.py drives the execution of scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py
@Diptanshu Jamgade Yes, it does.
Like @Steve Howell mentioned earlier, for some reason scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py generated the wrong kind of secrets file.
From line 2937 of the zulip_provision.log you shared: Generated /etc/zulip/zulip-secrets.conf with auto-generated secrets!
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py#L64
for development, that file should have been zproject/dev-secrets.conf
Great. Now in scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py it depends on extra_args[line 104] what mode it enters ! Could you please tell me what are the elements of the list extra_args?
@Diptanshu Jamgade basically, generate_secrets.py should be called with -d option and it is not
yes exactly ! so isn't it a problem with tools/provision.py ? because I dont have any -d here in my provision.py !
@Christie Koehler if we get the provisioning done today then I could sleep properly after 3 sleepless nights !
@Diptanshu Jamgade oh, I'm sorry this has been so frustrating!

@Christie Koehler No one is at a fault for this ! Infact, I should thank you as now I can answer provisioning doubts and that gives satisfaction ! So, finally is it that my version of zulip code has a problem or is it in the main repo too ?
@Diptanshu Jamgade I don't know yet. I can't reproduce the issue on my Windows machine. I have windows 10. I'm not using a proxy, though.
okay I see something
your zulip_provision.log shows the command as python -d scripts/setup/generate_secrets.py

https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/tools/provision.py#L181
here line 181 shows a -d param
the -d is in the wrong place!
But the tools/provision.py in my machine has none ! I just edited and reprovisioned
@Diptanshu Jamgade Okay, let me know how that works.
I am a little concerned your local clone has changes like this.

https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/tools/provision.py#L195 this line is giving me a + tools/setup/postgres-init-dev-db Exact error>> : No such file or directory << Traceback (most recent call last): File "tools/provision.py", line 217, in <module> sys.exit(main()) File "tools/provision.py", line 195, in main run(["tools/setup/postgres-init-dev-db"]) File "/srv/zulip/scripts/lib/zulip_tools.py", line 102, in run run_wrapper(args,**kwargs) File "/srv/zulip/scripts/lib/zulip_tools.py", line 101, in run_wrapper raise subprocess.CalledProcessError(retcode," ".join(args),output=output[1])# type: ignore # https://github.com/python/typeshed/pull/329 subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command 'tools/setup/postgres-init-dev-db' returned non-zero exit status 127

@Christie Koehler I would like to tell that the Exact Error>>..........<< is the main error faced by the child process run by subprocess.Popen(). That feature is what i have sent a pull request for . You might not get it locally !
No, I haven't seen that error locally.
you get this when you run vagrant provision again?
am running tools/provision.py ! would this make a difference ?
yes, it possibly could
I would run vagrant provision in Cygwin
@Christie Koehler vagrant provision is also giving me the same error !
@Diptanshu Jamgade I just want to make sure I know which version of Zulip you're trying to install. Can you let me know the output of git status and git log --all --graph --oneline --decorate ?
Git status gave the following error:
http://hastebin.com/xuyewatova.sql
For the other command the return is very long for hastebin :p
@Christie Koehler Do you in anyway suggest recloning ? or reforking ?
@Diptanshu Jamgade that is a lot of changed files!
I thought that is normal ! :p As in the insertion on ^M character everytime you open a file in windows . Am I wrong ?
There should be a way to configure so that doesn't happen.
Are any of these edits you want to keep?
what does git diff tools/provision.py tell you?
what program are you using to open these files?

just one. But I can do that again ! Ummmmm I would have to set a ff=unix in my vimrc file..... Vim !
We better not get into that diff thing cause that will highly mislead us ! @Tim Abbott and I are having troubles due to this reason ! which editor do you use ?
You suggest starting from level 0(reforking and reclonning ?) @Christie Koehler
Vi on windows.
I don't know that you need to re-fork, but it might be good to start again from a fresh clone
without making any changes
and see if it will complete provisioning then
Yes I could sense that too ! then the best solution for now is to start the clone ! THANK YOU @Christie Koehler I will definitely get back to you !

Provision on windows is giving me 

+ . scripts/setup/configure-rabbitmq
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tools/provision.py", line 221, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "tools/provision.py", line 194, in main
    run([".","scripts/setup/configure-rabbitmq"])
  File "/srv/zulip/scripts/lib/zulip_tools.py", line 95, in run
    process = subprocess.Popen(args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 710, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1327, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied

I am running Cygwin as an administrator. If i run the command . scripts/setup/configure-rabbitmq it kills my ssh terminal or is causing me to log out. This is a very strange behaviour that am facing recently.
@Diptanshu Jamgade how much RAM does your system have? I think you're probably experiencing OOM kills
@Tim Abbott my laptop has 8gb RAM !
Hmm, that should be totally fine. And with Vagrant, 2GB should be being allocated to the guest, which should be more than enough. Hmm.
I'd recommend running a second vagrant ssh terminal with top running while you try installing again and watch what happens in the top window.

This is what I'm getting:
Vagrant cannot forward the specified ports on this VM, since they
would collide with some other application that is already listening
on these ports. The forwarded port to 9991 is already in use
on the host machine.

To fix this, modify your current project's Vagrantfile to use another
port. Example, where '1234' would be replaced by a unique host port:

config.vm.network :forwarded_port, guest: 9991, host: 1234

Sometimes, Vagrant will attempt to auto-correct this for you. In this
case, Vagrant was unable to. This is usually because the guest machine
is in a state which doesn't allow modifying port forwarding. You could
try 'vagrant reload' (equivalent of running a halt followed by an up)
so vagrant can attempt to auto-correct this upon booting. Be warned
that any unsaved work might be lost.
this occured when I typed "vagrant up"
that means you already have a virtual machine running that's using those ports
open virtualbox and you should be able to see what's running
It says zulip_default is running
I would halt it and run vagrant up again

@Daniel Sun I would suggest throughly following http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev-env-first-time-contributors.html#configure-cygwin . You need to take care that for the /srv/zulip/tools/run-dev.py to run properly we need to provision the machine first . Moreover, whenever you are to provision from within the box i.e. after sshing into the vagrant box, you need to make sure you are in /srv/zulip/directory as it is the root directory and all the paths are relative.

I have followed the instructions I believe, and this is what my cygwin looks like:

$ echo 'export "CYGWIN=$CYGWIN winsymlinks:native"' >> ~/.bash_profile

Daniel@Daniel-PC ~/zulip
$ echo $CYGWIN
winsymlinks:native winsymlinks:native winsymlinks:native

that's the first thing to check, then make sure you have an internet connection. if you are using a proxy, there is additional setup required.
to troubleshoot, login to the guest with vagrant ssh and try running that command directly there to see if it gives you more info

okay, it looks like Git for Bash (which comes with Git for Windows, ver 2.10.1) will work.
You still need to run it as an administrator.

@Christie Koehler First of all am extremely sorry I knew the way around to the windows line endings error. I was not online .
Basically , @Daniel Sun there are two ways to solve that issue :
1. sudo apt-get install dos2unix to install dos2unix and then convert the file by dos2unix scripts/lib/setup-apt-repo . The proper conversion will give you a prompt of conversion done successfully and then the bad interpertor error won't be troubling you anymore.(remember this everytime you face windows line endings error).
2. If you use vim and have a basic idea about it then :set ff=unix will get the file to unix format and then you need to successfully save the file. You can make this default by setting up a :set ff=unix line n your .vimrc file if you happen to use vim regularly . Hope this helps. Kindly let us know !

@Diptanshu Jamgade You said you're using Vi/Vim ... are you running that inside of Cygwin, or outside of it in just Windows?

@Diptanshu Jamgade No, I have never seen that error in the many times I've set up Zulip on windows
@Diptanshu Jamgade exactly how did you clone the zulip code?
same question for @Daniel Sun whenever you're online again
oh I was just able to reproduce it
it happens when core.autocrlf is set to true
and possible when it is not set at all
okay, so the solution for now, if you have no changes you need to keep, is to run git config --global core.autocrlf input to change the setting, rm the zulip directory and then re-clone.
oh, but make sure you vagrant halt before removing the zulip directory

fyi fixes for the Windows line-endings documented here https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/2012 and here https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/2013

@Diptanshu Jamgade Generally, I first try to figure out what state your system is in and how you got there.

Because I have tested the Zulip setup many, many times on Windows, Ubuntu and OS X, I know it works most of the time. So, usually if there is a problem, it is specific to a person's circumstance. Sometimes we call this an "edge case."

@Diptanshu Jamgade Another thing to know: the Zulip codebase is very complex. So is the script that sets up the developer environment. The more complex a system is, the more you can encounter errors that are confusing. Confusing because they can point to the problem in one area when really the source of the problem is somewhere very different.

You were focusing on the rabbitmq error, which makes sense. It is only through experience with the code and the setup process that I know that error is likely not directly about rabbitmq, but something earlier in the processes.
Thank you @Christie Koehler . The large and complex codebase problem is what I too have faced couple of times. I will definitely keep it in mind.

@Diptanshu Jamgade Also, if you are following a project's setup guide and you do something different than what it says, it's helpful to say that when you're asking for help.
